page.title: 04The Devil's Apron Strings
page.content: On the crest of Mynydd Machen, near the path crossing from Danygraig to Machen, is an outcrop of rock known as "Where the Devil broke his apron strings". It consists of a pile of stones, resembling a collapsed wall, on the face of a small rise. One version of the local story to account for its presence is that the Devil, for reasons known only to himself, decided to obliterate Cardiff. To do so, he picked up a load of stones from a similar outcrop near Pontypool and put the stones in his apron. He then flew directly to Cardiff but as he passed over Mynydd Machen his apron strings broke and the stones fell to their present position. { {(This story is recalled by Hugh {Roberts, ex-Lord Mayor of Islwyn)
